results.title: Grace
results.creator_credit: Damien Power, Isabel Perez, AFTRS and Alice Addison
results.brief_description:
A lonely girl left looking after the family motel finds her life is about to change when a sophisticated and elegant woman books in for the night.
Cast: Mariel McClovey, Angela Punch McGregor, Tim Richards

results.title: Violence is Violence
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description: A report on the concerns over the private toll road which was built at the expense of over 2 hectares of public parkland in inner Sydney. Hundreds of Sydney residents take over the streets to protest car-dominated public space and offer a vision of urban sustainability. Their celebration is met with a brutal police response. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Birth of a film festival
results.brief_description: Not many people know that the Melbourne International Film Festival was born at Olinda on the Australia Day weekend in January 1952, when a group of die-hard film buffs found that the only way they could see the European and Asian films they craved was to organise their own film festival. This documentary, filmed at the 50th Melbourne International Film Festival opening night, provides a fascinating glimpse of a significant event in Australian film culture through interviews, archival footage and stills.

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: The Telegram Man
results.creator_credit: James Khehtie, Ceinwen Berry and Victoria Wharfe McIntyre
results.brief_description: Multi-award-winning film ‘The Telegram Man’ poignantly depicts the human cost of war in its portrayal of relationships impacted by the vicissitudes of wartime. Featuring restrained but deeply emotional performances from some of Australia’s finest screen actors (Jack Thompson, Gary Sweet and Sigrid Thornton), this is a powerful film about loss, grief and duty.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: St Mary's Anglican Girls' College and Tessa Laing
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.
